candidates.description: For over twenty years, Erdoğan has reshaped Turkey. He transformed the judiciary, invested in infrastructure, and reasserted Turkish influence on the world stage. But his time is marked by growing authoritarianism concerns, refugee crisis, corruption allegations and economic mismanagement. Now, facing the most serious electoral challenge of his career, he must convince voters that his vision for Turkey remains the best path forward. Will his legacy survive the economic storm, or is his era coming to an end?

Leader of the Republican People's Party (CHP), Kiliçdaroğlu represents the unified opposition's chance to end Erdoğan's rule. A former bureaucrat with a reputation for integrity, he built the coalition that now challenges the incumbent. But he lacks Erdoğan's charisma and command of the media. Can he convert anger over the economy into an election victory, or will divisions within his coalition undermine his campaign?
A hardline loyalist with decades of political power. Aligning with him signals strength to conservative voters.
The charismatic mayor of Turkey's largest city and a rising opposition star. Pairing with him boosts urban and younger voter appeal.
Another successful opposition mayor with a reputation for competence, but he can alienate the Kurdish voters because of his MHP (Nationalist Movement Party) past.

A fiery nationalist politician leading the Ancestral Alliance, Oğan appeals to nationalist voters skeptical of both Erdoğan and the leftist opposition. Charismatic and uncompromising, he could fracture Erdoğan's base or become a kingmaker in a tight race. His unpredictability makes him one of the election's most volatile forces.

A charismatic former CHP leader, Ince broke from the main opposition to run his own campaign. Known for his passionate speeches and populist appeals, he competes for the same voters as Kiliçdaroğlu. His independent candidacy could either energize the opposition or split the anti-Erdoğan vote.

Son of a legendary Islamist leader, Necmettin Erbakan, Erbakan carries his father's legacy as head of the Welfare Again Party. He appeals to devout Muslims and those seeking an Islamist alternative. Though his party is smaller, his messaging resonates deeply with his base. Can nostalgia for his father's movement translate into real electoral gains?

Zekeriya is the leader of the Hüda (God) Party, which is closely tied to the Kurdish Islamist terrorist organization "Hizbullah". Nevertheless, he is popular in his hometown of Batman and nearby cities and can bring a lot of Kurdish voters to your side. That said, don't choose him. It would be political suicide and destroy your nationalist credibility.

issues.name: Erdogan
issues.description: How voters view Erdoğan's twenty-year leadership.

issues.name: Social
issues.description: Liberal values like Feminism and secular governance versus Conservative emphasis on Islamic tradition and conservative family structures.

issues.name: Foreign Policy
issues.description: Some want Turkey asserting regional power; others prefer diplomacy and stability with neighbors.

issues.name: Urbanization
issues.description: The divide between modern cities and traditional rural areas

questions.description: Your ally, Devlet Bahçeli, declares his full support in your candidacy and offers his help in your re-election campaign.

answers.description: The Nationalist Movement Party and Mr. Bahçeli have already written their names in Turkish political history with their pioneering, facilitating, supportive, and constructive attitudes under the People's Alliance in solving all of our country's chronic problems.
answers.feedback: You surprise nobody by allying yourself with Bahçeli, he will bring some nationalist voters to your side.

questions.description: To lock down the conservative Kurdish vote in the Southeast and counter the opposition's "Nation Alliance," you have invited Zekeriya Yapıcıoğlu and his party, HÜDA PAR, into your "People's Alliance." Immediately, the opposition and even some of your own nationalist supporters are in an uproar. They are digging up archives of "Kurdish Hezbollah" from the 90s and pointing to Yapıcıoğlu’s demands to change the Constitution and remove the "Turkishness" oath from schools. The media is calling this a "dark alliance."

answers.description: There are some uglinesses attributed to HÜDA PAR. HÜDA PAR does not accept these; they say 'we have no connection with terrorism.' They are a completely domestic and national structure. I find their support for the People's Alliance very important and valuable.
answers.feedback: I don't know why do you continue to associate with him, but you're gaining support from some Kurdish regions, especially because the opposition naturally identifies with nationalists because of your actions.

answers.description: Those who walk hand-in-hand with the extensions of the terrorist organization Qandil (PKK) have no right to speak to us! HÜDA PAR is a party that acts within the legal framework of our Constitution. They are not like those who take instructions from the mountains!
answers.feedback: They say attack is the best defense, but everyone knows that some of your opponents are affiliated with pro-Kurdish circles. Your recent pivot, however, is unprecedented.

answers.description: There is no debate for us regarding the first four articles of the Constitution. Our stance on this matter is clear. We are working on a civilian constitution, but the foundational pillars of our Republic are not up for discussion.
answers.feedback: Then why did you choose Zekeriya as the mascot for your campaign?

questions.description: Turkey's economic troubles are intensifying dramatically. The Turkish lira is weakening significantly against the dollar, and inflation is beginning to rise. Most orthodox economic analysts, including your Director of Central bank, agree that your low interest rate policy is one of the reasons. Will you finally raise the rates?

answers.description: Those who try to impose on us a link between the benchmark rate and inflation are either illiterates or traitors. Fire the Central Bank Governor and replace him with someone who knows his business and keeps the rates low. We will save our investors and citizens from interest rate oppression.
answers.feedback: Your rural base is happy as they can now borrow money at low rates without encountering high inflation, but the urban population is frustrated. "Erdoganomics" is destroying confidence in the economy and your poll numbers

answers.description: With the support of tight monetary policy, we will bring down inflation to single digits again. We can temporarily increase the rates or at least keep them where they are.
answers.feedback: This will not significantly decrease inflation, but it will give the economy some breathing room. That said, some of your core supporters are confused or even angered at this reversal of your position.

questions.description: The Istanbul Convention, a human rights treaty opposing domestic violence on women, is getting criticized by Islamists, especially by the conservative leader Fatih Erbakan for being against Islamic family values on issues concerning divorces and LGBT. What will be your response?

answers.description: The Istanbul Convention, originally intended to promote women's rights, was hijacked by a group of people attempting to normalize homosexuality — which is incompatible with Turkey’s social and family values. We will withdraw from it.
answers.feedback: This is a conservative response that will motivate your base.

answers.description: We can never tolerate even a single woman in our country being exposed to violence incurring the violation of her rights, law, and dignity. The Convention should stay for now, even with its faults.
answers.feedback: Erbakan continues with his attacks, but at least you surprise feminists and westerners.

answers.description: What can I say? The important thing is that our people are happy, the sun is shining, and life goes on.
answers.feedback: Great dodge, but Erbakan will keep reminding you of your position on this.

questions.description: A convicted Turkish organized crime boss named Sedat Peker, now living in exile, has posted a series of explosive videos on YouTube making serious accusations against several government officials and AK Party politicians. The videos include claims of corruption, organized crime connections, and ties between the state and the mafia. The videos have gone viral with millions of views, and the scandal is dominating Turkish media and social conversation.

answers.description: We discuss and evaluate every issue about our country openly, but we do not do it through terrorists or members of criminal organizations. Shame on those who take this clown seriously.
answers.feedback: An expected rebuke, but his videos are still popular.

answers.description: We have been destroying criminal organizations one by one for 19 years. We are pursuing members of criminal gangs wherever they may flee in the world. We will hand over criminal gangs to the judiciary.
answers.feedback: This statement could be interpreted as both supportive or dismissive of Peker's claims. Ultimately though, it's pretty boring.

answers.description: Social media has turned into one of the main sources of threats to today’s democracy. We must monitor it more closely.
answers.feedback: Your acts against the media backfired as more people got interested in Peker's claims, but your core supporters are at least satisfied with the punishment of "liar" media

questions.description: After your recent decision about cutting rates, the lira fell to a new record low trading at 10.7738 against the dollar. What is your reaction?

answers.description: I will never compromise on this because interest rates are a malady that make the rich even richer, and the poor even poorer. We will lower the rates even rurther.
answers.feedback: The lira dropped to an all-time low of 18.36 TRY to the dollar.

answers.description: I want all my citizens to keep their savings in our own money, to run all their business with our own money, and I recommend this... As long as we don't take our own money as a benchmark, we are doomed to sink. The Turkish Lira, our money, that is what we will go forward with. Not with this foreign currency or that foreign currency.
answers.feedback: Good try, but lira keeps losing it's value.

answers.description: We are protecting the country's economy from attacks by foreign financial tools that can disrupt the financial system. And we will win.
answers.feedback: The "foreign influence" excuse lost its effect because of your visible rate moves.

answers.description: God willing, we will stabilise all fluctuations in prices and forex rates in not such a long time. We will stop cutting the rates for now.
answers.feedback: A pragmatic decision, even if it disappointed some of your supporters who were planning on borrowing.

questions.description: Due to high inflation and mismanagement of the economy, the cost of living in urban areas has skyrocketed. Rent and energy prices, in particular, have become unbearable, and the opposition uses the "kitchen economy" issue to attack you.

answers.description: You know of my battle with interest rates. We are lowering interest rates and we will lower them. Know that inflation will fall too then, it will fall more.
answers.feedback: Well, you are definitely sticking to your guns here.

answers.description: We will definitely solve this cost of living issue that is troubling all of us. I am announcing a significant minimum wage hike to combat this situation.
answers.feedback: Increases in the minimum wage are always popular, but some pundits claim that they keep inflation high.

answers.description: We are aware of all the difficulties our retirees are experiencing, particularly with regard to the cost of living. We will do pension adjustments to help our elderly.
answers.feedback: While this helps keep your elderly base intact, students and urban workers are still furious.

questions.description: Russia has just invaded Ukraine, sparking the largest war in Europe since 1945. Turkey's Black Sea borders and grain exports are suddenly at risk, while NATO eyes your strategic position. Will you condemn Putin outright or position Turkey as a mediator?

answers.description: Our support for Ukraine's territorial integrity, sovereignty and independence is unwavering. We will provide the necessary support to Ukrainians and impose sanctions on the Russian regime.
answers.feedback: Really? After spending years trying to distance Turkey from the Western sphere by increasing trade with Russia and buying S-400s, you do this? The West is pleased and has offered some support, but the backlash from the Russians is much more severe. The economy is suffering, and your pro-Western actions have confused nationalists.

answers.description: As Turkey, we have always maintained a policy of balance between Ukraine and Russia. From now on, we will continue to follow that balanced policy. We will also mediate the issue of grain exports.
answers.feedback: Thanks to Turkey's regional influence, you have successfully maintained good relations with both countries, and your approval ratings have risen as the public has come to trust your foreign policy credentials.

answers.description: I can say very clearly that I do not find the attitude of the West... to be correct, because it is a policy based on provocations. Putin has some good points in this matter.
answers.feedback: While this pleases many nationalists and boosts your anti-Western image, the economy will not like these provocative words against the EU and US at all.

questions.description: Six opposition leaders have openly formed the "Table of Six," an electoral alliance that unites against you and will nominate a single candidate. In addition to the Republican People's Party, the alliance includes parties with members from your past administrations, such as Babacan and Davutoğlu. How will you respond to this threat?

answers.description: They appear in public as the "Table of Six", but it's still unclear who's really in front or behind this table. Their aim is to make Turkey dependent again.
answers.feedback: You are linking your opposition to foreign intelligence, which is pretty typical of you, and motivates your base.

answers.description: These are chair lovers, chasing old grudges and accounts, they don't have any ideas at all. They don't care about this country.
answers.feedback: You are focusing on former allies, which could be a good strategy since both your voters and most of your opposition are wary of them. However, some advisors think you are missing an opportunity by not focusing solely on the main opposition.

questions.description: Tensions over Syrian refugees are escalating sharply in 2022. Anti-refugee protests and attacks on Syrian neighborhoods have broken out in several cities, fueled by rising rents, unemployment claims, and viral social media videos. Public opinion polls show over 80% of Turks now want mass repatriation. How will you address this growing crisis?

answers.description: We opened our hearts [as the Ansar once did]. Those who want to stay here are welcome. Racism doesn't exist in our DNA.
answers.feedback: This is an unpopular position, but some business owners and Europeans are happy with this response. However, be careful of the growing nationalist opposition.

answers.description: We will never compromise our country's security and the preservation of our demographic structure. The deportations will start pretty soon.
answers.feedback: This is a reversal of your previous position, but a popular one. Still, nationalist opposition keeps growing, and you lose some momentum as your supporters are trying desperately to change their rhetoric on the issue.

answers.description: It is our duty to fulfil our citizens' expectations about this issue through ways and means that befit our country. Legal immigrants are welcome, but illegals should be deported.
answers.feedback: This is more in line with the national position, but it's boring and everyone ignores it.

questions.description: Opposition mayors Ekrem İmamoğlu in Istanbul and Mansur Yavaş in Ankara continue to showcase effective governance through accelerated metro projects, expanded social aid programs, transparent budgeting, and public services despite central government obstacles. Their high popularity highlights them as viable alternatives to your administration, raising questions about what Turkey would look like without your leadership. How will you respond to these narratives?

answers.description: Incompetent who cannot even provide water to Ankara for weeks, I am not naming names, but he knows who he is.. Instead of wagging your finger, do your job.
answers.feedback: Mansur Yavaş is the more popular of the two, especially among your base. Your attacks have put him in the spotlight, making Kurdish opposition voters nervous because of his nationalist past.

answers.description: They are doing social media municipalism in Istanbul, there is no service. What a shame!
answers.feedback: Attacking Imamoglu is pretty typical, but it also increases his popularity among the opposition. This could be dangerous for you because he is a much stronger candidate against yourself than many others mentioned, like Kılıçdaroğlu.

answers.description: In CHP municipalities, service is zero, social media is abundant. Metropolitan cities have sunk, the people are waiting for service.
answers.feedback: This changes nothing, but also risks nothing.

questions.description: İyi Party leader Meral Akşener, one of the opposition leaders, holds joint rallies with Istanbul Mayor Ekrem İmamoğlu, fueling speculation and confusion over who will be the Table of Six's joint presidential candidate against you. Kılıçdaroğlu remains the CHP favorite, but Akşener's moves suggest İmamoğlu could emerge as a stronger contender. Public polls show growing debate within the opposition. How will you address this internal opposition chaos?

answers.description: Okay, you're lazy about determining the candidate, we get that, but at least study a bit while forming your promises. Opposition have no ideas, no goals, nothing. They just attack me.
answers.feedback: Classic criticism, and to be honest, any conflict within the opposition helps you, even if only a little.

answers.description: I don't care, really. Despite them, my nation will make me both a candidate and President.
answers.feedback: Allowing your enemies to destroy themselves is a smart move.

answers.description: The mismatched six. 6 dark alliance. Blind-deaf alliance. This is their situation.
answers.feedback: Attacking them heavily could be a good strategy considering their inconsistency, but it also unites them against you.

questions.description: Fatih Erbakan, leader of the Welfare Again Party and son of former Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan, officially announces his independent presidential candidacy for 2023. He positions himself as the true voice of Milli Görüş values, criticizing your government for deviating from Islamic principles and economic justice. This risks splitting the conservative vote in your heartland. How will you respond to his challenge?

answers.description: Those who truly care for the nation come under one roof; division only benefits enemies.
answers.feedback: Not directly mentioning Erbakan's name is good, but he's still rising in the polls.

answers.description: Those who walked the path with the late Teacher Erbakan are also us, all of us. Those who use Teacher Erbakan's name to stand against us betray his spirit.
answers.feedback: This is a harsh attack on the man's son himself. It will embolden Fatih Erbakan, but perhaps he can also steal voters from the opposition?

answers.description: Look, the weather is beautiful today, isn't it? Such nice sunshine—let's enjoy that instead of all these questions.
answers.feedback: It is indeed nice.

questions.description: In early 2023, far-right activist Rasmus Paludan burns a Quran outside the Turkish embassy in Stockholm, sparking massive protests in Turkey and a furious backlash against Sweden's NATO membership bid. Public outrage is intense, with many Turks seeing it as an insult to Islam and national dignity. Sweden's government condemns the act but defends free speech. How will you respond to this crisis?

answers.description: Sweden, don't even bother! As long as you allow my holy book, the Quran, to be burned and torn, and you do so together with your security forces, we will not say ‘yes’ to your entry into NATO! We will eventually teach the arrogant Western people that it is not freedom of expression to insult the sacred values of Muslims.
answers.feedback: Expected answer, but many claim that you're just exploiting the issue for electoral purposes.

answers.description: Shall we have tea first? Questions later.
answers.feedback: Turkish tea is the best.

questions.description: On February 6, 2023, two massive earthquakes (7.8 and 7.5 magnitude) struck southern Turkey and Syria, killing tens of thousands, destroying cities, and displacing millions in 11 provinces.

answers.description: We are facing one of the worst disasters in our history.
answers.feedback: Although the emergency response has been heavily criticized, the affected regions have shown appreciation and support for the aid.

questions.description: In the weeks following the February 6 earthquakes, intense backlash grows against the government's response. Survivors in tent cities face freezing conditions, delayed aid, collapsed search efforts, and accusations of favoritism in relief distribution. Opposition figures and social media highlight destroyed buildings linked to construction amnesties granted under your administration, while some demand accountability. How will you address this mounting criticism in the run-up to the May elections?

answers.description: Some dishonorable, dishonest people are making false statements such as ‘We didn’t see any soldiers or police helping us.’ Our soldiers and police are honorable. We won’t let the disreputable speak of them like this.
answers.feedback: The criticism continues.

answers.description: These ungrateful people, who see it as their duty to throw mud at every project, work, service, and investment for the nation, is trying to turn our earthquake victims' pain into profit and exploit their emotions. They left no slander unsaid, no lie untold, no disinformation undone.
answers.feedback: Your harsh tone doesn't come off well in the aftermath of this, but some of your supporters agree with you.

answers.description: The 2023 earthquakes inflicted a direct economic cost of $104 billion and an indirect cost of $150 billion. From the moment of the earthquake, as the state, we have been on the ground with all our institutions
answers.feedback: This answer is neutral, grounded answer, but some say that you're giving ground to the opposition.

questions.description: You extend the state of emergency in the 11 earthquake-hit provinces for another three months. This grants expanded powers for rapid reconstruction, aid distribution, and security measures amid ongoing recovery efforts. Critics accuse the move of centralizing control and limiting local opposition oversight just weeks before the May elections, while supporters praise it as essential for swift rebuilding. How will you frame and defend this decision publicly?

answers.description: We declared a state of emergency in 10 provinces to ensure that search and rescue operations and subsequent work can be carried out swiftly. By taking every necessary step, we will carry out a disaster response that won’t leave anyone under the rubble and will not leave anyone to suffer.
answers.feedback: It looks professional that you don't mention politics. Besides, it's not like most Turks care much about this anyway.

answers.description: In a period like this, I cannot stomach people conducting negative campaigns for political interest. Because today is the time for unity.
answers.feedback: Critics accuse you of ignoring the topic.

questions.description: The wait is over. After months of infighting and the dramatic "Table of Six" crisis, the opposition has finally confirmed Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu as their joint presidential candidate. Until now, you’ve mocked them for not having a candidate; now that they do, you need to define him before he can define himself. He is positioning himself as a "quiet, democratic healer," but you know his weak spot: his long record of losing elections against you. He is also one of the few politicians who are as unpopular as you are.

answers.description: Finally, 'Bay Kemal' (Mr. Kemal) has summoned the courage to come out and face us. He used to say 'Bay Kemal' in a challenging way. Well, we say: 'Bay Bay Kemal' (Bye Bye Kemal)! My nation will retire him for good on May 14.
answers.feedback: "Vote for Tayyip now, you can vote for Kemal anytime"

answers.description: They fought for days just to pick a name. If they can’t even manage a table of six, how will they manage Turkey? After this ugly fight, they nominated their candidate with great difficulty. They are distributing vice presidencies like candy just to keep the table together!
answers.feedback: Good job emphasizing the internal differences within the opposition. Some are confused by your ignoring of Kılıçdaroğlu, though.

answers.description: Who is cheering for his candidacy? Qandil (PKK) is cheering. Pennsylvania (FETÖ) is cheering. The enemies of Turkey are cheering. We will not leave this country in the hands of those who walk hand-in-hand with terror organizations.
answers.feedback: It's true that Kılıçdaroğlu is not at all liked by nationalists, and this is an important point to emphasize.

questions.description: On March 16, 2023, Sinan Oğan, a former MHP MP and nationalist figure, officially announces his presidential candidacy under the Ancestral Alliance (Ultranationalist Victory Party + others). He campaigns heavily on anti-refugee rhetoric, promising mass deportations of Syrians and framing himself as the true defender of Turkish nationalism against both your government and the opposition's 'soft' stance. This threatens to split the nationalist vote in your strongholds. How will you respond to his entry into the race?

answers.description: Those who cannot even pass 5% cannot pass judgment on this nation’s future.
answers.feedback: It could be smart to ignore him, but he is everywhere in the media, accusing you of participating in demographic warfare. However, some say he is gaining support from opposition voters.

answers.description: The words Sinan Oğan said are irresponsible words. There is no such thing as kicking refugees out or slapping them — that is inhumane. These people are using refugees as election material, while we are pursuing a humane repatriation policy.
answers.feedback: Simply put, your stance here is unpopular.

answers.description: Sinan Oğan’s statements are provocative and aimed at disrupting social peace. Statements like those of him only create chaos, they do not produce solutions.
answers.feedback: This is an interesting criticism, and people are noticing that you aren't defending refugees. Nevertheless, his poll numbers are rising.

questions.description: Muharrem İnce's centrist and populist independent campaign experiences a surprising surge. His fiery rallies, direct social media attacks on both your government and the Table of Six, and charismatic style are gaining strong traction among disillusioned youth and secular nationalists. Recent polls show him siphoning significant votes from Kılıçdaroğlu's base, potentially pushing the opposition below the threshold for a competitive runoff. How will you respond to this unexpected rise in his popularity?

answers.description: They keep stabbing each other in the back. The opposition is scattered, fragmented. They are eating each other.
answers.feedback: Your attacks on İnce harm his campaign because he is being accused of being a government stooge.

answers.description: İnce is running a nonsense campaign. What does he know about the economy? He couldn't even be an apprentice.
answers.feedback: Your efforts to help his campaign by making him relevant haven't gone unnoticed, yet he continues to rise in the polls.

answers.description: ''Take care of Muharrem a little, you understand? Pump him up a bit, send people to his rallies, boost his voice on social media. Let him steal Kemal's votes, split that table's votes. That table is going to fall apart anyway, if Muharrem gets a little more wind he’ll really weaken Kemal. Then our job in the second round becomes easy. But don’t overdo it, don’t make him too big, or else he’ll turn on us. Agreed?''
answers.feedback: I see what you are doing here, I like it. But this could be dangerous.

questions.description: Rumors explode across social media and opposition channels claiming you are seriously ill after a brief pause in campaign events and a few canceled appearances. Videos of you appearing tired or unsteady at recent rallies fuel speculation, with some claiming hospitalization or health issues that could affect your ability to continue the race. The opposition seizes on it to question leadership stability just weeks before the election. How will you address these swirling health rumors publicly?

answers.description: Due to my intense program, I caught a stomach cold. I'm doing fine now. In fact, after today, I will continue my programs at the rallies.
answers.feedback: It turned out to be nothing as you indeed continued rallying.

answers.description: No matter how much disinformation they spread... they cannot change the reality. They're just afraid of losing.
answers.feedback: This is an aggressive response, but it could be useful.

questions.description: In late April and early May 2023, your government launches a massive pre-election economic relief package: minimum wage increased by 45%, early retirement (EYT) for 2+ million people implemented, natural gas subsidies extended for households, pension bonuses doubled, and direct cash aid distributed widely. Critics call it 'election bribes' to buy votes amid high inflation, but many low-income families and retirees benefit immediately. How will you present and defend this spending surge to the public?

answers.description: We are upsetting those who have been saying 'you can't do it' since the first day, those table friends of 'Bye Bye Kemal'. They said 'there is no gas.' We found it, we extracted it, and now we are bringing it to our people's doorsteps. They call these 'election investments.' No, this is the fruit of a vision we have been knitting for 21 years.
answers.feedback: They can say whatever they want, people like these aids.

answers.description: They are disturbed by the fact that our citizens are breathing a sigh of relief. They ask where the money comes from. It comes from the resources of this country that we didn't let thieves steal.
We increased the lowest pension to 7,500 Liras. We will continue to improve the conditions of our retirees. We increased the holiday bonuses by nearly 100 percent. It's a gift for the feast.
answers.feedback: You ignore the opposition, which could be beneficial during this time.

questions.description: Just days before the election, a "sex tape" and fake financial records targeting presidential candidate Muharrem İnce are leaked online. İnce denounces the images as Israeli-sourced deepfakes and blames a "reputation assassination" orchestrated by FETÖ (the Gülen movement) to clear the path for the main opposition. While İnce is a rival, the scandal creates a massive backlash against "dirty politics." The opposition is trying to distance itself from the leak. You must decide whether to condemn the tactic as a threat to all politicians or use it to remind voters that your main opponent, Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu, originally rose to power following a similar tape scandal years ago.

answers.description: I called Mr. Muharrem today. I expressed my sadness over what has happened. I told him, 'If there is anything we can do as the State, we are ready.' This is a character assassination that no one should accept.
answers.feedback: This is a neutral answer. Also, people seem to sympathize with İnce on this issue.

answers.description: They are trying to design Turkey's future not through the ballot box, but through digital plots, montages, and conspiracies. My nation will not surrender its will to those who play with tapes.
While we are talking about our national car Togg, our aircraft carriers, and our natural gas, they are busy with tapes. This is the difference between us and them.
answers.feedback: This answer dismisses İnce's claims. Advisors thought there could be a more direct response.

answers.description: They attacked him with tapes. Now, I ask: Who is behind this? This is the tactic of the terrorist organization FETÖ. But wait, how did 'Bye Bye Kemal' get into his seat? He also got there with a tape.
answers.feedback: An obvious connection, but İnce clarifies that he doesn't want you to use his situation.

questions.description: The problem continues: Fatih Erbakan is siphoning off your pious voters by attacking your economic record and demanding radical social concessions, specifically the repeal of Law 6284 (which protects women against domestic violence) and a full crackdown on LGBT organizations. This could force a second round and jeopardize your victory.

answers.description: Our doors are open to everyone who says 'Morality and Spirituality first.' We do not look at political differences; we look at the common cause of our nation.
answers.feedback: Your approach with Erbakan is working. He realizes that he isn't polling well enough to continue his campaign, but he is demanding huge concessions. Nevertheless, you have eliminated a dangerous opponent.

answers.description: Those who set out on their own today must think about whose mill they are carrying water for. This election is a choice between those who protect the family and those who take orders from global centers.
answers.feedback: Erbakan is offended by this aggressive approach, yet he still joins your Nation's Alliance and supports you after realizing this will not end good for him, albeit with less enthusiasm than expected.

answers.description: We are the ones who turned Teacher Erbakan's dreams into reality, from Hagia Sophia to the domestic industry. Others may carry the name, but we carry the struggle
answers.feedback: Erbakan gives a harsh answer, and the cooperation ideas between you two gets forgotten. Hopefully this ends good.

questions.description: Just three days before the election, the political landscape is rocked as candidate Muharrem İnce officially withdraws from the race. He has been the target of a brutal "tape" campaign involving deepfakes. Although he was only polling at low percentages, the opposition believes his exit will help Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu win in the first round. However, İnce is furious at the "reputation assassination" and points the finger at FETÖ (the Gülen movement) and the opposition's pressure. He will remain on the ballot.

answers.description: One of the candidates has withdrawn. Honestly, I was saddened. I wish this race had continued until the end like this. But I don't know what happened or why he was forced to withdraw.
answers.feedback: You are playing the good guy, but I doubt many ex-İnce supporters will vote for you now. Your best chance is them not voting.

answers.description: They forced a candidate to withdraw. 'Bye Bye Kemal,' you came [to your post] with a tape, we know this. My nation will not bring you somewhere with a tape or a CD; on the contrary, they will say 'bye bye' to you.
answers.feedback: This will earn you cheers and laughs at rallies.

answers.description: FETÖ methods are at work again. They are trying to design politics with the methods of terrorist organizations. We will not surrender the national will to those who play with tapes.

questions.description: Your covert operation to bolster Muharrem İnce has backfired. A whistleblower from within the Ministry of Interior has leaked documents allegedly showing that İnce’s campaign logistics and social media "bot" armies were funded by pro-government businessmen. The opposition media is in a frenzy, calling İnce a "Trojan Horse" sent by the Palace (Saray) to steal votes from Kılıçdaroğlu. İnce is losing supporters by the second, and the scandal is now starting to stain your reputation as a fair leader.

answers.description: They are now inventing 'Palace-backed candidate' lies. Look at them! They are so incompetent that they accuse everyone who doesn't support them of being our agent. This is a sickness of the heart.
answers.feedback: Not everyone believes these accusations, but it hurt both your campaign and İnce's indeed.

answers.description: Those who can't win at the ballot box are trying to design politics through fabrications and 'leaks.' This is the signature of Pennsylvania (FETÖ). They are trying to set my nation’s candidates against each other.
answers.feedback: This is not a good enough response. Still, you deflected it for now.

answers.description: They say we are supporting him. Why would we? We have the nation behind us! We don't need 'secret support' or 'Trojan horses.' Our record of service is our only support.
answers.feedback: Few people believe your assurance of having the nation behind you, but the "allegations" from the opposition isn't fully trusted either.

questions.description: The first ballots are being counted, and the results appearing on state-run agencies are causing a shockwave. For weeks, every major polling company predicted you were trailing behind Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu, with some even suggesting a first-round loss. However, as the boxes from Anatolia open, you are overperforming the polls by a large margin. The opposition is in a frenzy, accusing agencies of "manipulation," but the data shows your base has held firm.

answers.description: They thought they could design Turkish politics through social media operations and ordered polls. But they forgot one thing: The National Will! Those who looked at the polls were wrong; those who looked at the people will win!

questions.description: The 2019 Istanbul municipical has made Ekrem İmamoğlu a household name. He is young, energetic, and possesses a unique ability to speak to both secularists, Kurds and conservative alike. Or as they say. However, he and some of his loyal supporters want him as the candidate, which you can't let happen. Your decision to put him on the spotlight could be risky.

answers.description: They said 'if the CHP comes, they will cut the social aid.' What happened? Our mayors, especially in Istanbul, increased the aid. They even started giving milk to the children of this city.
answers.feedback: You are emphasizing his time in Istanbul, which is understandable since it is by far the most populous city in Turkey.

answers.description: Ekrem İmamoğlu is my son. It is my duty to protect him just as it is my duty to protect my own party. We have a bond of soul and a bond of struggle.
answers.feedback: He will help with the youth and the urban vote.

questions.description:
The public is restless. A massive wave of support has formed behind the "Metropolitan Mayors" who won in 2019. In the conservative heartlands and among nationalist voters, Mansur Yavaş is seen as a hero; a quiet, serious "state man" who provides social aid without showing off. Your ally Meral Akşener’s İYİ Party is subtly (and sometimes loudly) pushing for his name.

You have decided to put Mansur Yavaş at the center of your strategy. But there is a catch: You can't let anyone other than you become the opposition candidate in this election. So be careful not to promote him too much.

answers.description: Our mayors are doing a great job. I want my mayors to continue their duties. They have a responsibility to the people who elected them. Dear Mansur is currently transforming Ankara into a world capital. We shouldn't interrupt this success.
answers.feedback: Many are disappointed that Yavaş will not play a larger role in your campaign.

answers.description: Mansur Yavaş is a man of his word. He proved that when we spend the nation's money, we must account for every cent. He doesn't marginalize anyone. Whether they are from this party or that party, he solves their problems. This is the model for the new Turkey
answers.feedback: Although he is indeed popular, Kurds and leftists doesn't like him because of his nationalist past.

questions.description: Turkey is a country of deep, unhealed scars. You decide to record a video from your study, announcing that you are going on a "journey of reconciliation." You want to ask for helallik (blessing/forgiveness) from groups the CHP has historically marginalized or the state has oppressed. Your own party’s hardline secularists are furious, calling it a "surrender of Republican values," while the government mocks it as a "fake apology" to win votes.

answers.description: We will seek forgiveness from our daughters who were forced into 'persuasion rooms' because of their headscarves. We will seek forgiveness from the victims of February 28th coup d'etat. I want to leave a legacy of peace, not a legacy of old fights.
answers.feedback: The criticism continues, but this will help win over some of Erdogan's dissatisfied voters.

answers.description: Our country is a land of wounded people. We will reconcile with Roboski, with Sivas, with the prisoners of Diyarbakır, and with the minorities of September 6-7. Kurdish and Alevi citizens should not feel excluded.
answers.feedback: You're making a big effort to court minorities, especially Kurds and Alevis, but your nationalist coalition partners are offended by your accusations of "state crimes" in Roboski.

answers.description: I have seen enough hate and love in my life. I want love to win now. We have been stuck in the past for too long. It is time to embrace each other and move on.
answers.feedback: Boooooring.... People switch to sport channels as you speak on TV

questions.description:
In October 2021, the political atmosphere in Turkey is reaching a boiling point. Allegations of corruption are surfacing from within the bureaucracy, and the "TÜGVA documents" (leaked internal papers concerning a pro-government foundation) are dominating the headlines.

As Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu, you are receiving a flood of "whistleblower" documents from state officials who are uncomfortable with the orders they are receiving. You need to send a clear message to the bureaucracy: "The era of the 'Individual State' is ending, and the 'Lawful State' is returning."

answers.description: I am calling out to the honorable civil servants of this state. You are not the clerks of the Erdoğan family; you are the officials of the Turkish Republic. As of Monday, stop supporting illegal requests. This is your 'Kılıçdaroğlu brother's' last call to you. The power is changing. When it does, investigations will start. Do not think you can escape by saying 'I took orders.' Under the law, an illegal order cannot be fulfilled. If you sign it, you bear the crime.
answers.feedback: This sounds threatening, and the government media is using your remarks to prove that if elected, you will punish and fire state employees, a Turkish political tradition from decades ago. However, you motivated your supporters.

answers.description: Documents are flowing to us. Patriotic bureaucrats are doing their duty. We have formed a special team to examine these corruption files. Stay brave; we are coming to clean the state together.
answers.feedback: Erdogan calls you a terrorist and accuses you of running a parallel state. Public opinion is divided.

questions.description: The Turkish Lira is in freefall. In just a few months, it has plummeted from 8 TRY to over 13 TRY per Dollar. Inflation is skyrocketing, and basic goods like sunflower oil and flour are disappearing from shelves or doubling in price. President Erdoğan has declared an "Economic War of Independence," claiming high interest rates are the "mother of all evil." You are sitting in your kitchen, the place that will soon become your primary "studio", recording a video for a nation that is terrified about how they will afford their next meal.

answers.description: I will end poverty in this country. No mother will ever say, 'The pot isn't boiling in my kitchen' again. That pot will boil. If it doesn't boil in your house, it won't boil in Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu's house either.
answers.feedback: That's good populist sentiment. Your numbers in the polls are increasing as the economy gets worse.

answers.description: They have turned the Turkish Lira into a scrap of paper against the Dollar. If those who did this are 'local and national,' then who is 'anti-national'? Turkey is not being governed; Turkey is being tossed around like a leaf.
answers.feedback: Many agree with you.

answers.description: I went to the Central Bank because its independence has been destroyed. I told them: 'Do not follow illegal orders that against the public interest.' This state is not the property of one man; it belongs to 85 million people.
answers.feedback: This is a good signal to more urban, rich supporters, but your opponents laugh at you.

questions.description: The year 2021 is coming to a close. In the Grand National Assembly (TBMM) and on live television, you are no longer just an "organizer" of the opposition, you are starting to sound like a man who wants to lead the country himself. The media is picking up on your change in tone, and the AKP benches have started heckling you during speeches, shouting, "Why don't you just announce your candidacy already?"

answers.description: They keep shouting 'Be a candidate!' from the AKP rows. Who told you I won't be a candidate? Why are you so worried? If the Alliance accepts, there is no problem; I would be honored to fulfill this duty.
answers.feedback: Most of your party's supporters view the thought of you being the candidate as a nightmare because of your electoral history. They hope this is just a bluff.

answers.description: It is not about 'Kemal' or 'Recep.' It is about the Republic versus the One-Man Regime. We will decide our candidate together, as all opposition leaders. Our goal is not just to win an election, but to build a democracy where the leader isn't a Sultan.
answers.feedback: Good answer, but heckling continues.

questions.description: The wind is in your sails, but it’s blowing in two different directions. Following the 2019 local election victories, your two superstars: Ekrem İmamoğlu (Istanbul) and Mansur Yavaş (Ankara) are consistently beating Erdoğan in every public poll. Inside the CHP, a civil war of "preferences" is brewing. One wing of the party wants the high-energy, media-savvy appeal of İmamoğlu to capture the youth and Kurdish votes. Another wing wants the "state-serious," nationalist-conservative appeal of Yavaş to peel away AKP and MHP voters. Meanwhile, your loyalists insist that you must be the candidate to ensure a transition back to a parliamentary system.

answers.description: Our mayors have a duty to fulfill. We cannot leave Istanbul or Ankara back in the hands of those who betrayed them. They will serve their second terms as well. We won those cities with the nation's trust; we won't hand them back to the Palace.
answers.feedback: Even if you are ultimately going to be the candidate, it's too early to announce it. Young voters are horrified by your clarification that you will likely be the one and they are protesting this decision.

answers.description: We used to have a province called Van. It's still there, by the sea of Van.
answers.feedback: Well done on ignoring this issue. It's probably better than anything else you could do.

questions.description: It is February 12, 2022. For the first time, you have gathered the leaders of five other opposition parties at Ahlatlıbel to form what the public is calling the "Table of Six" (Altılı Masa). On paper, you are meeting to discuss the "Strengthened Parliamentary System." In reality, everyone in the room knows the real question is: Who will be the candidate? Meral Akşener, leader of the centre-right İyi Party, is wary, and the smaller parties are looking for guarantees.

answers.description: If the alliance agrees, I would be honored to serve. The leader of the largest party in an alliance naturally carries the weight of the struggle. We are not just picking a name; we are picking the state's future captain.
answers.feedback: Akşener politely disagrees, the differences between the leaders become clearer.

answers.description: The candidate is not important, the system is. The six leaders will decide together. I am not a man of ego; I am a man of the state. Whatever the Table decides, we will follow it. Our strength is our unity, not a single individual.
answers.feedback: Akşener and the others nod in agreement, but this only perpetuates the uncertainty.

answers.description: Turkey is tired of 'One-Man' shows. We don't need another Erdoğan. We need a President who will be a bridge, who will consult with the leaders, and who will eventually return to the Parliamentary system. I am ready to be that bridge.
answers.feedback: You are trying to justify your candidacy, and Erdogan is responding strongly by challenging you to announce your campaign now.

questions.description: The polling numbers are becoming impossible to ignore. Every week, a new survey from companies like METROPOLL or KONDA hits the headlines. The data shows a consistent trend: While the "National Alliance" is gaining ground, the voters have clear favorites. Mansur Yavaş beats Erdoğan by double digits; Ekrem İmamoğlu is comfortably ahead; but you, Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu, are often within the margin of error or slightly behind. Your ally Meral Akşener has started using the phrase "Winnable Candidate" (Kazanacak Aday) as a subtle warning to you.

answers.description: Polls can be misleading. They don't reflect the deep current of the streets. When we hit the field, when we explain our vision, those numbers will change. I don't look at the polls; I look at the people’s eyes. We are not looking for a popular name; we are looking for a statesman.
answers.feedback: Most people believe in polls when they mention how unpopular you are.

answers.description: The issue is not just winning an election. The issue is: Who will heal the state? Who will ensure the transition to the Parliamentary system? A candidate who wins by 60% but keeps the Palace system alive is not a winner for democracy. We are looking for a candidate who will represent the 'Common Mind'.
answers.feedback: Your poll numbers keep stalling.

questions.description: As Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu, you are successfully consolidating the "Table of Six," but there is a hole in your hull. While the left and the liberals are with you, the Nationalist-Conservative voters are skeptical. The government is hammering you daily, calling the CHP "anti-state" and claiming you are under the thumb of the HDP (pro-Kurdish party). Even your ally Meral Akşener is under pressure from her own base. You need to prove that a social democrat can still be a "True" Nationalist.

answers.description: They talk about nationalism, but they sold the Tank-Pallet factory to Qatar. I am the true nationalist! My nationalism is the nationalism of Atatürk. Our borders are our honor. We will not let this country become a refugee warehouse.
answers.feedback: This resonates deeply with nationalist voters. However, your liberal advisors doubt that many will join your camp. Meanwhile your leftist and Kurdish supporters are demotivated.

answers.description: I am not a man of the Palace. I drink my warm soup and I go to bed. That is my nationalism.
answers.feedback: You are trying to double down on populism, but people are wondering why are you ignoring the actual issue.

answers.description: They ask about my Kurdish policy. Look, I am a 'Seyyid' (descendant of the Prophet). My lineage is clear. I don't need to prove my Turkishness to anyone.
answers.feedback: Weird answer, but it's interpreted as a pivot to Islamists and Kurds. Nationalists maintain their criticism.

questions.description:
The court has just sentenced Istanbul mayor Ekrem İmamoğlu to 2 years and 7 months in prison, including a political ban, for "insulting" election officials. The news breaks while you are on a high-profile "vision visit" in Germany.

While you are abroad, Meral Akşener immediately rushes to the Istanbul Municipality, hugging İmamoğlu and appearing on a bus with him to address thousands of protesters. The media is screaming: "Where is Kemal?" and "Akşener has found her candidate!" You have to fly back to Istanbul in the middle of the night, realizing that your "son" might have just become a political martyr, and a rival, in your absence.

answers.description: Ekrem İmamoğlu is my son. It is my duty to protect him just as it is my duty to protect my own party. There is a father-son relationship between us. He is a child of the CHP as much as he is my child.
answers.feedback: Everyone is saying that Erdogan is trying to disqualify Imamoglu from the candidacy to help you because you are seen as a much weaker candidate.

answers.description: I did not expect such a verdict; I thought it would be an acquittal. My visits to England, America, and Germany are for Turkey's rapid growth. We will not let the Palace design our candidate through illegal court orders.
answers.feedback: You are trying to defend your location during the sentencing, but the accusations that you are happy because of İmamoğlu's defeat continues.

answers.description: To those responsible, İmamoğlu is a big bite, he will stick in your throat! We would choke you! You were appointed, he was elected by the people. We will not hand over Istanbul’s resources to your plunder order.
answers.feedback: People finally cheer at your words, but you get sidelined compared to İmamoğlu. This will make it harder for people to accept your candidacy later on.

questions.description: In a surprising turn of events, Fatih Erbakan (leader of the Welfare Again Party and son of the legendary Necmettin Erbakan) has initially rejected an alliance with Erdoğan, declaring he will run as an independent Presidential candidate. For a moment, the conservative "People's Alliance" vote looks split. You, Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu, have a golden opportunity to reach out to these religious-conservative voters who feel abandoned by the AKP but are wary of the CHP.

answers.description: I respect Mr. Erbakan's decision. It shows that there is a deep discomfort even within the conservative ranks. We are coming to build a Turkey where everyone, including those from the Milli Görüş tradition, can live with dignity and justice.
answers.feedback: Meh, both Erbakan and Erdogan's supporters don't really care about your words, but this will help you anyway.

answers.description: If you known me, I go to bed at 10 PM. I am a quiet man.
answers.feedback: You're ignoring the issue while Erbakan keeps rising in the polls.

questions.description: On February 6, 2023, Turkey is hit by two massive earthquakes. The destruction is apocalyptic. For the first two days, the state response is criticized for being slow and disorganized. President Erdoğan declares a State of Emergency and warns that he is "keeping a notebook" of those who spread "disinformation."

answers.description: I refuse to look at what is happening as 'above politics' and align myself with the government. This collapse is exactly the result of systematic rent-seeking politics. I will not meet with Erdoğan, his palace, or his rent gangs on any platform. I will fight my people's fight until the end!
answers.feedback: You are heavily attacked for being "divisive" during a crisis, but it resonates with your supporters.

answers.description: In this country, they shared everything—money, power, land—except the pain. No one wanted to share the pain. But I am here to share it.
answers.feedback: Non controversial answer. You still benefit from this because of the decrease in Erdogan's numbers.

answers.description: Corruption in the state has a cost. We saw that cost today. We saw lives that could have been saved, but weren't, because merit was destroyed in the bureaucracy.
answers.feedback: These are accepted accusations, but some advisors wanted you to be more aggressive.

questions.description: It is the lead-up to May 14, 2023. While all eyes are on the duel between you and Erdoğan, another figure has emerged from the Ancestral Alliance: Sinan Oğan. Representing a "secular-nationalist" third way, Oğan is pulling away young, nationalist voters who find you "too soft on the HDP/Kurdish Seperatists" and Erdoğan "too soft on refugees." Your advisors warn you that Oğan might push the election to a second round.

answers.description: We met with Mr. Oğan to discuss the safety of the ballot boxes. We have common concerns about the demographics of the country. Every candidate adds color to our democracy. We will win together by focusing on our shared love for the Republic.
answers.feedback: Oğan uses these meetings to boost his own profile, and he keeps gaining ground in crucial cities.

answers.description: It is now clear who stands with the people and who stands with the Palace. To those who sold their stance for a seat: I wouldn't even give you my shoes to polish, let alone a place in this government!
answers.feedback: You dropped the "Polite Grandpa" act, which energizes your supporters who see Oğan as a "palace agent." He replies more forcefully though, and he is certainly the more popular of the two of you.

answers.description: I am announcing it here: I will send all refugees back! I am a nationalist, I am a patriot. I will not let our cities be invaded. Those who call themselves 'third way' are just helping the Palace. The real struggle is here.
answers.feedback: This is a good attempt to court nationalist voters, but Oğan is still standing strong. Also some of your Kurdish supporters are demoralized and point to this as a reason why they should have run their own candidate.

questions.description: The moment of truth has arrived. On March 2, after a grueling meeting, five out of six leaders agreed on your candidacy. But Meral Akşener refuses. On March 3, she holds a press conference that shocks the nation, calling the Table of Six a "Notary Hub" and a "Gambling Table." She publicly calls on your "sons," İmamoğlu and Yavaş, to revolt against you and run for President themselves.

answers.description: Don't worry, all the pieces will fall into place. We will continue to enlarge our table. We will not change Turkey by ignoring or looking down on anyone. We don't want 'Erdoğanism' to come back under a different name.
answers.feedback: Thankfully your mayors don't budge, and Akşener is forced to return to the "Gambling Table".

questions.description: You are now the official Presidential candidate of the Nation Alliance. However, the ghost of the "Winnable Candidate" debate still haunts the streets. Millions of voters are still deeply attached to Ekrem İmamoğlu and Mansur Yavaş. If you keep them only as mayors, you risk a "low energy" campaign. If you pull them in too far, you risk losing control of the great cities of Istanbul and Ankara to the AKP-majority councils.

answers.description: My dear nation, we will work very, very hard. We have no other choice. Ekrem President is on my left, Mansur President is on my right. Come on, my presidents, we say 'Bismillah!' My brave men, we have a lot to do.
answers.feedback: You announce that both of the mayors will be your vice presidents, which recovers some of the support you lost after announcing your candidacy.

answers.description: Why Ekrem İmamoğlu, why Mansur Yavaş? Because we have two important capitals in our history: Istanbul, the capital of the Ottoman Empire, and Ankara, the capital of the Republic. These two actors will now serve the entire country.
answers.feedback: Your focus on Turkey's two biggest cities hasn't gone unnoticed, but the effect will be minor.

questions.description: The drama surrounding Fatih Erbakan has reached its peak. After initially refusing to join the "People’s Alliance" and even collecting signatures to run as an independent candidate, Erbakan has suddenly reversed his decision. Following a private meeting with Erdoğan, he announced that the New Welfare Party (YRP) will support the government.

answers.description: Do you know the cost of one liter of milk? Look at the kitchen, look at the price of onions.
answers.feedback: Well this is bad news for you, but it's smart to just keep talking about inflation.

questions.description: It is April 2023, and the "Ince Phenomenon" is taking over TikTok and the youth. Your former comrade and 2018 candidate, Muharrem İnce, has launched a fierce campaign. He is dancing in his bus and uploading videos to Tiktok, appealing to the "Z-generation" energy, and most importantly, attacking both you and Erdoğan as "the same old politics." Polls show him at 3-5%, mostly siphoning votes from your "Nation Alliance." Your supporters are terrified that he will push the election to a second round, giving Erdoğan time to recover. On March 29, you visited him at the Homeland Party headquarters to find a middle ground, but the meeting ended with his famous and cold farewell: "Hoş geldiniz, güle güle" (Welcome and goodbye).

answers.description: We are trying to enlarge the table. We want to be together, to act together. The problems we face are far beyond individual issues; they are Turkey’s problems. I am calling to Mr. İnce: Let’s put the old grudges aside. My call is still valid.
answers.feedback: You maintain the image of unity, but it's quickly ignored by everyone.

answers.description: This is not a time for dances or personal shows. This is a time to save the Republic. Those who divide the opposition are, whether they admit it or not, carrying water to the Palace’s mill. Don't be deceived by shows; look at the reality of your empty pots.
answers.feedback: Calm down, grandpa.

answers.description: I want to address the young people of Turkey: Your youth was stolen from you! You have to think twice even about buying a cup of coffee. You have no money left for anything. But I promise you: I will take back every penny stolen from you by the gangs and give it back to you. The first-time voters will send a dictator away
answers.feedback: This is a good focus on younger voters, but some say you are just ignoring İnce. He keeps rising in the polls.

questions.description:
The 2023 campaign has turned into a clash of styles. Recep Tayyip Erdoğan is positioning himself as the high-energy, "World Leader" who opens mega-projects, drives locally produced cars, and speaks at massive rallies. Meanwhile, his campaign machine is framing you as a "tired bureaucrat" who is too old and too "slow" for the job.

Erdoğan has coined the nickname "Bay Bay Kemal" (Bye Bye Kemal) and repeatedly reminds the public of your time as the Director of the Social Security Institution (SSK) in the 90s, using grainy footage of hospital queues from that time to label you an "incapable clerk."

answers.description: You called me 'incapable' and 'failed,' Erdoğan, but you are just trying to delay the inevitable. Everything will pass. Just get some good rest, and please, don't neglect your medicine. Don't let them upset you.
answers.feedback: Even though you're mocking him, his attacks still have credibility among the public.

answers.description: Erdoğan lives in the Palace, he has no idea what is happening on the street. He is busy with PR; my people are busy trying to find a piece of bread."
answers.feedback: You could be right, but this doesn't counter Erdogan's attacks.

answers.description: He acts like a world leader, but he took the first plane to Moscow to see Putin after our soldiers were martyred. He didn't even send his own sons to do their military service, he paid for their exemption! Don't talk to me about bravery.
answers.feedback: These are both good topics to remind the public about.

questions.description: For decades, your Alevi identity has been, allegedly, used against you in whispers and dark social media campaigns. Critics have hinted that "a person with your background" could never get the votes of the conservative Sunni majority. You decide that enough is enough. Late at night, you sit in your kitchen and record a video titled simply: "Alevi." You speak directly to the young people voting for the first time, publicly declaring your faith and calling for an end to sectarian divisions. What will you mention in the video?

answers.description: My dear children, I am an Alevi. I am a sincere Muslim raised with the faith of Hak-Muhammed-Ali. I have a soul given by God; I do not violate the rights of others. I do not stretch my hand toward what is forbidden. We don't choose our identities; we are born with them. But we can choose to be good people.
answers.feedback: You gain respect among the Alevi community, but your advisors are doubtful that this will change anything. Erdoğan accuses you of trying to create sectarian divisions.

answers.description: Dear youth, are you going to say to this system, which says an Alevi cannot be President, that the one who is right, honest, and moral can be? With a single vote, you will pull this country out of these painful sectarian debates and carry it to where it belongs!
answers.feedback: This is a serious accusation to make against the "System". While some conservative voters are scared by this type of rhetoric, you energize your supporters.

answers.description: Yes, I am an Alevi. Since when has this been a crime in this country? Someone who says 'Give me your blessing' doesn't question your faith; they ask for a common future. I have rejected identity politics my whole life, and I will continue to do so.
answers.feedback: This is a middle-ground answer.

questions.description:
As election day nears, Erdoğan has opened the state's vaults. He has passed the EYT (Early Retirement) law, something he swore he would never do, granted massive wage hikes to civil servants, and announced that natural gas will be free for one month after "discovering" it in the Black Sea.

To many, it looks like a "populist spending spree" designed to buy back the votes lost to inflation. As Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu, you face a dilemma: if you criticize the spending, you look like you're against the people getting money. If you stay silent, he gains all the credit.

answers.description: They worked for months and said 'We'll solve it so Kılıçdaroğlu doesn't get the credit.' I have never seen such an incapable government! I told them a thousand times how to solve EYT, and they finally had to do it. They are doing my homework, but they are doing it badly!
answers.feedback: It's true that many of these were your campaign promises, but that doesn't change the fact that Erdogan is gaining votes from this.

answers.description: He gives you free gas for a month? I will give you the 418 billion dollars back that the gangs stole! They give you a little soup to keep you quiet, while they take the whole kitchen to London. Don't be fooled by the 'election bribe'; look at the hole in your pocket!
answers.feedback: You maintain your "anti-corruption" brand. It appeals to the core base, but some swing voters who just received their first retirement check might find you "ungrateful" or "too angry".

answers.description: The civil servants have been ruined! Their livelihoods have been destroyed. As soon as I come to power, I will raise the lowest civil servant salary to 2.5 times the minimum wage. Mr. Kemal spent 27.5 years as a civil servant; if anyone can bring spring to you, it is Mr. Kemal!
answers.feedback: This is a good, populist response that will motivate your base.

questions.description: Just days before the first round, the election is rocked by a scandal. Muharrem İnce has been targeted by what he calls a "reputation assassination" sex tapes and forged bank statements (the "10-million-lira deposit" claim) circulated by opposition-linked accounts. Distraught and feeling abandoned by both sides, İnce withdraws from the race, saying, "I am withdrawing so they (i.e you) have no excuses when they lose." And he is still on the ballot.

answers.description: Dear Russian Friends, You are the ones behind the montages, conspiracies, Deep Fake content, and tapes released in this country yesterday. If you want our friendship to continue after May 15, take your hands off the Turkish state. We are still in favor of cooperation and friendship.
answers.feedback: This will sound strange to the public, and your accusations against the Russians won't gain any traction. You gained some votes from former İnce supporters but your overall favorability decreased because of the "reputation assassination" claims.

answers.description: My call is still valid. Let's put the old grudges and resentments aside. We welcome Mr. İnce to the Table of Turkey. Please, come join us. Let's bring change together.
answers.feedback: He ignores you. You gained some votes from former İnce supporters but your overall favorability decreased because of the "reputation assassination" claims.

questions.description:
The election has entered its most brutal phase. President Erdoğan is showing videos at his massive rallies that appear to show terrorist PKK leaders in the mountains clapping along to your campaign song, "Haydi." You know these are montages, but the imagery is playing on repeat across every state-controlled channel.

The government’s message is simple: "If Kılıçdaroğlu wins, Kandil (PKK headquarters) wins." This is the "survival" (beka) narrative. It is draining your support in the nationalist heartland of Anatolia. You need to break this perception without sounding like you are attacking the Kurdish voters whose support you also need.

answers.description: I am saying it clearly: Whoever collaborates with terror organizations, whoever walks with them, whoever sits at the table with them, may God damn them! My path is the path of the state, the path of the people. To call me a collaborator is the greatest insult to my 27.5 years of state service.
answers.feedback: It sounds cool, but everyone knows how pro-HDP/Kurdish you are.

answers.description: A man who does montages cannot be President! You are a fraud. You are showing fake videos to the nation because you cannot explain the price of onions or the hunger of the people. May God protect us from frauds.
answers.feedback: Sure the video is fake, but your remarks supporting HDP/Kurdish autonomy is widely shared by Erdogan supporters. This will hurt you.

answers.description: Who sat at the table with PKK in Oslo 2009? You did. Who welcomed terrorists with red carpets at Habur that same year? You did. Who sent judges to the feet of the PKK during the "peace process"? You did! You are the one who gave them legitimacy, and now you try to smear 'Mr. Kemal' with your own sins. I will never sit at a table with terror!
answers.feedback: It's great to fire back, but a response like this will worry your Kurdish voters. Hopefully nationalists will make up for that.

questions.description: It is around 8:00 PM on election night. For months, nearly every reputable poll predicted you would be leading, with some even suggesting a first-round victory. But as the first ballots are opened and Anadolu Agency (AA) begins broadcasting, the screen shows a shocking reality: Erdogan is outperforming every poll.

answers.description: Hassiktir...
answers.feedback: Hassiktir indeed.

scenarioDescription: It is March 2021. 2023 will mark 100 years since the founding of the Turkish Republic, a momentous centennial. But this historic anniversary will be overshadowed by an unprecedented political crisis. President Erdoğan has ruled Turkey for nearly two decades, but rising inflation and economic turmoil threaten his grip on power. The opposition has united for the first time, sensing opportunity. The 2023 election will be Turkey's most consequential in years, a genuine test of whether Erdoğan can secure another term or if a new era awaits. Every decision you make will determine Turkey's future.
